pathAssistantSteps.info: The goal is to obtain and assess information that is important for a future employment relationship; blue. interests, wishes, attitudes to work, resources and the need for assistance. The jobseeker and the job specialist must together define realistic goals for the jobseeker's further career. The labor market must be used as an arena in career planning - both to obtain information about different professions, and when using job tastes. After finding out what kind of work is realistic, you must together find out what type of assistance the jobseeker and potential employers will need in and out of the workplace. This forms the basis for the professional profile. A CV must be prepared that can be used in the process of finding work, as well as in future job search processes.

In this phase, the jobseeker becomes an employee. The action plan must clarify what kind of training the employee needs, and how the natural assistance available in the workplace can be used. The employee must get to know both the work and the corporate culture, as well as have the opportunity to establish good relationships with colleagues. Both removing, replacing and adding work tasks can be relevant to achieve a good job match. The employer should be offered support and training in accepting employees with various challenges and / or disabilities. Regular meetings should be held where the action plan is revised. The goal is to gradually reduce the assistance from job specialists.
pathAssistantSteps.picklistValueName: Education and training in and / or outside the workplace

pathAssistantSteps.info: Now its time to put jobseekers in touch with potential employers and start a collaboration. The main goal is to develop a good job match; that is, correspondence between a jobseeker's skills, prerequisites and needs and an employer's requirements for competence and work tasks. The career profile forms the basis for what kind of jobs you are looking for. The job specialist contacts employers with the aim of building a relationship, preferably over several meetings, in order to introduce SE and eventually the jobseeker. Jobseekers can also contact employers on their own. Often there will be a need to practice job search skills, including writing job applications and interview training. When you succeed in finding a suitable job, the job starts with securing a job, through close collaboration with the jobseeker and employer
pathAssistantSteps.picklistValueName: Find a suitable job / Collaborate with AG

pathAssistantSteps.info: This step means that the jobseeker must receive information about the service, in order in this way and be able to make an informed choice about whether the person in question wishes to accept it or not. The job specialist must explain what the SE process will entail, so that the jobseeker is aware of this. It is important to provide clear, accurate and consistent information, and establish a relationship based on respect and confidentiality. The information should be provided at a language level adapted to the jobseeker, and it is important to make sure that the jobseeker has understood the information that has been provided.
